cards.name: Abundance
cards.text: If you would draw a card, you may instead choose land or nonland and reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Akoum Refuge
cards.text:
Akoum Refuge enters the battlefield tapped.
When Akoum Refuge enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: "There is no justice when some profit and others go without."
cards.name: Alms Collector
cards.text:
Flash
If an opponent would draw two or more cards, instead you and that player each draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Conquering your first world is the hardest, after all. My power grew as I moved from world to world, taking anything that would make the next taking easier."
—Ob Nixilis
cards.name: Ambition's Cost
cards.text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.

cards.flavor: "So many have died in search of that map. And now it appears in the hands of the arrogant child Chandra Nalaar."
cards.name: Anowon, the Ruin Sage
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player sacrifices a non-Vampire creature.

cards.flavor: A mage willing to dedicate his life to his craft.
cards.name: Apprentice Necromancer
cards.text: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Apprentice Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste. At the beginning of the next end step, sacrifice it.

cards.name: Arahbo, Roar of the World
cards.text:
Eminence - At the beginning of combat on your turn, if Arahbo, Roar of the World is in the command zone or on the battlefield, another target Cat you control gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

Whenever another Cat you control attacks, you may pay {1}{G}{W}. If you do, it gains trample and gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is its power.

cards.flavor:
"We must rely on our own knowledge, not on the dogma of the seekers or the mutterings of the sphinxes."
—Tullus of Palandius
cards.name: Arcane Sanctum
cards.text:
Arcane Sanctum enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W}, {U}, or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: He has journeyed where none have been before. Now he returns to ensure that none follow.
cards.name: Arcanis the Omnipotent
cards.text:
{T}: Draw three cards.
{2}{U}{U}: Return Arcanis the Omnipotent to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "Words of power never disappear. They sleep, awaiting those with the will to rouse them."
cards.name: Archaeomancer
cards.text: When Archaeomancer enters the battlefield, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Mirrodin's creator still lives, still shapes metal, and still commands world-shaking power.
cards.name: Argentum Armor

cards.flavor: The mysterious purpose of two of the rings had eluded Esper mages—until now.
cards.name: Armillary Sphere
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Armillary Sphere: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"Her hunger knows no limit. Left unchecked, she would feast on all of Tarkir."
—Yasova Dragonclaw
cards.name: Atarka, World Render
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Whenever a Dragon you control attacks, it gains double strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Choices belong to those with the luxuries of time and distance. We have neither. I recommend we proceed with the plan to destroy all shrines of the kami."
—Lady Azami, letter to Sensei Hisoka
cards.name: Azami, Lady of Scrolls
cards.text: Tap an untapped Wizard you control: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "What weapon will you bear against one who's mastered them all?"
cards.name: Balan, Wandering Knight
cards.text:
First strike
Balan, Wandering Knight has double strike as long as two or more Equipment are attached to it.
{1}{W}: Attach all Equipment you control to Balan.

cards.flavor: Those who worship the great gargantuans could hardly be expected to fight with a subtle weapon.
cards.name: Behemoth Sledge
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2 and has lifelink and trample.
Equip {3}

cards.name: Black Market
cards.text:
Whenever a creature dies, put a charge counter on Black Market.
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add {B} to your mana pool for each charge counter on Black Market.

cards.name: Blade of the Bloodchief
cards.text:
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on equipped creature. If equipped creature is a Vampire, put two +1/+1 counters on it instead.
Equip {1}

cards.name: Bladewing the Risen
cards.text:
Flying
When Bladewing the Risen enters the battlefield, you may return target Dragon permanent card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
{B}{R}: Dragon creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Blighted Woodland
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{3}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Blighted Woodland: Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: By the time your knees have worn through your robe, you may have begun to learn your place."
cards.name: Blind Obedience
cards.text:
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
Artifacts and creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor: "Great art can never be created without great suffering."
cards.name: Blood Artist
cards.text: Whenever Blood Artist or another creature dies, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Blood Baron of Vizkopa
cards.text:
Lifelink, protection from white and from black
As long as you have 30 or more life and an opponent has 10 or less life, Blood Baron of Vizkopa gets +6/+6 and has flying.

cards.name: Bloodfell Caves
cards.text:
Bloodfell Caves enters the battlefield tapped.
When Bloodfell Caves enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Spilled blood always begets more of the same.
cards.name: Bloodforged Battle-Axe
Bloodhusk Ritualist
cards.text:
Multikicker {B} (You may pay an additional {B} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
When Bloodhusk Ritualist enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card for each time it was kicked.

cards.flavor: "The veil of death hides little from our kind."
cards.name: Bloodline Necromancer
cards.text:
Lifelink
When Bloodline Necromancer enters the battlefield, you may return target Vampire or Wizard creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Bloodlord of Vaasgoth
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)
Flying
Whenever you cast a Vampire creature spell, it gains bloodthirst 3.

cards.flavor: "My liege will lead and I will follow—to the battlefield, to the grave, and beyond."
cards.name: Bloodsworn Steward
cards.text:
Flying
Commander creatures you control get +2/+2 and have haste.

cards.name: Blood Tribute
cards.text:
Kicker-Tap an untapped Vampire you control. (You may tap a Vampire you control in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Target opponent loses half his or her life, rounded up. If Blood Tribute was kicked, you gain life equal to the life lost this way.

cards.name: Blossoming Sands
cards.text:
Blossoming Sands enters the battlefield tapped.
When Blossoming Sands enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: "I am who I pretend to be."
cards.name: Body Double
cards.text: You may have Body Double enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature card in a graveyard.

cards.name: Bojuka Bog
cards.text:
Bojuka Bog enters the battlefield tapped.
When Bojuka Bog enters the battlefield, exile all cards from target player's graveyard.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Death arrives on tattered wings and stolen bones.
cards.name: Boneyard Scourge
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a Dragon you control dies while Boneyard Scourge is in your graveyard, you may pay {1}{B}. If you do, return Boneyard Scourge from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Boros Garrison
cards.text:
Boros Garrison enters the battlefield tapped.
When Boros Garrison enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {R}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: It promises protection to those in need and proclaims a warning to any who would threaten Ravnican law.
cards.name: Boros Guildgate
cards.text:
Boros Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"Have you ever held a Boros signet? There's a weight to it that belies its size—a weight of strength and of pride." 
—Agrus Kos
cards.name: Boros Signet
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Add {R}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Frozen in fear, the goblins stared upward at the circling hunter—and were promptly eaten by its diving mate.
cards.name: Broodmate Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Broodmate Dragon enters the battlefield, create a 4/4 red Dragon creature token with flying.

cards.flavor: His verdict is always guilty. His sentence is always death.
cards.name: Butcher of Malakir
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Butcher of Malakir or another creature you control dies, each opponent sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Captivating Vampire
cards.text:
Other Vampire creatures you control get +1/+1.
Tap five untapped Vampires you control: Gain control of target creature. It becomes a Vampire in addition to its other types.

cards.name: Cauldron Dance
cards.text:
Cast Cauldron Dance only during combat.
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Return it to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.
You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Its controller sacrifices it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Chaos Warp
cards.text: The owner of target permanent shuffles it into his or her library, then reveals the top card of his or her library. If it's a permanent card, he or she puts it onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: A mudflow swallowed the lowlands years ago. All that remains are a bottomless mire and an endless rain of ash.
cards.name: Cinder Barrens
cards.text:
Cinder Barrens enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Their lust for battle was so great that they didn't care their enemies wore their own faces.
cards.name: Clone Legion
cards.text: For each creature target player controls, create a token that's a copy of that creature.

cards.name: Comet Storm
cards.text:
Multikicker {1} (You may pay an additional {1} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Choose target creature or player, then choose another target creature or player for each time Comet Storm was kicked. Comet Storm deals X damage to each of them.

cards.flavor: It harmonizes with the essence of its master.
cards.name: Commander's Sphere
cards.text:
{T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color in your commander's color identity.
Sacrifice Commander's Sphere: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: When defeat is near and guidance is scarce, all eyes look in one direction.
cards.name: Command Tower
cards.text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color in your commander's color identity.

cards.flavor:
"No doubt the arbiters would put you away, after all the documents are signed. But I will have justice now." 
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage
cards.name: Condemn
cards.text: Put target attacking creature on the bottom of its owner's library. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Consuming Vapors
cards.text:
Target player sacrifices a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: Even when the flesh grows cold, knowledge waits in the bones for a master to release it.
cards.name: Corpse Augur
cards.text: When Corpse Augur dies, you draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of creature cards in target player's graveyard.

cards.flavor: Do not fear the lightning. Fear the one it obeys.
cards.name: Crackling Doom
cards.text: Crackling Doom deals 2 damage to each opponent. Each opponent sacrifices a creature with the greatest power among creatures he or she controls.

cards.flavor: The finest soldiers aren't worth a whit without a set of hands to lead them and a set of eyes to guide them.
cards.name: Crimson Honor Guard
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of each player's end step, Crimson Honor Guard deals 4 damage to that player unless he or she controls a commander.

cards.flavor: A pretty bauble of persecution.
cards.name: Crosis's Charm
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
• Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Crosis, the Purger
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Crosis, the Purger deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, choose a color, then that player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.

cards.flavor:
"The dragon is a perfect marriage of power and the will to use it." 
—Sarkhan Vol
cards.name: Crucible of Fire
cards.text: Dragon creatures you control get +3/+3.

cards.name: Crucible of the Spirit Dragon
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Crucible of the Spirit Dragon.
{T}, Remove X storage counters from Crucible of the Spirit Dragon: Add X mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast Dragon spells or activate abilities of Dragons.

cards.flavor:
"They say the ruins of Sedraxis were once a shining capital in Vithia. Now it is a blight, a place to be avoided by the living."
—Olcot, Rider of Joffik
cards.name: Crumbling Necropolis
cards.text:
Crumbling Necropolis enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U}, {B}, or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"Your veil's curse won't stop me, deathmage. I have taken down countless night hunters and this dark plane is not big enough for you to hide." 
—Garruk Wildspeaker, to Liliana Vess
cards.name: Crushing Vines
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Destroy target creature with flying.
• Destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: Ugin's whispered summons led Sarkhan Vol to the moment that would echo down the centuries and seal Tarkir's fate: the primal battle between Ugin and Nicol Bolas.
cards.name: Crux of Fate
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Destroy all Dragon creatures.
• Destroy all non-Dragon creatures.

cards.flavor: All seeds share a common bond, calling to each other across infinity.
cards.name: Cultivate
cards.text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put one onto the battlefield tapped and the other into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Flavorful aromas beckon many a salivating maw.
cards.name: Curse of Bounty
cards.text:
Enchant player

Whenever enchanted player is attacked, untap all nonland permanents you control. Each opponent attacking that player untaps all nonland permanents he or she controls.

cards.flavor: Sounds of life beckon many a restless soul.
cards.name: Curse of Disturbance
cards.text:
Enchant player

Whenever enchanted player is attacked, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token. Each opponent attacking that player does the same.

cards.flavor: Jingling coins beckon many an eager hand.
cards.name: Curse of Opulence
cards.text:
Enchant player

Whenever enchanted player is attacked, create a colorless artifact token named Gold. It has "Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool." Each opponent attacking that player does the same.

cards.flavor: Idle chatter beckons many an attentive ear.
cards.name: Curse of Verbosity
cards.text:
Enchant player

Whenever enchanted player is attacked, draw a card. Each opponent attacking that player does the same.

cards.flavor: Good health beckons many a vigorous follower.
cards.name: Curse of Vitality
cards.text:
Enchant player

Whenever enchanted player is attacked, you gain 2 life. Each opponent attacking that player does the same.

cards.flavor:
"Silumgar's mind is a dark labyrinth, full of grim secrets and subtle traps."
—Siara, the Dragon's Mouth

cards.text: Target player draws X cards and loses X life.

cards.flavor: "Ah, this is a nice life. I can see why you were so desperate to keep it."
cards.name: Dark Impostor
cards.text:
{4}{B}{B}: Exile target creature and put a +1/+1 counter on Dark Impostor.
Dark Impostor has all activated abilities of all creature cards exiled with it.

cards.flavor:
"It reflects the purity of Mirrodin-that-was." 
—Koth of the Hammer

Indestructible

Flying

cards.text:
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.
Cycling {3}{B}{B} ({3}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Pain, all creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Dinner and politics don't mix.

cards.flavor: Survival of the purest.

cards.text:
Each player chooses a creature he or she controls. Destroy the rest.
Flashback {5}{W}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.text:
As Door of Destinies enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Whenever you cast a spell of the chosen type, put a charge counter on Door of Destinies.
Creatures you control of the chosen type get +1/+1 for each charge counter on Door of Destinies.

cards.flavor: Atarka serving-goblins coat themselves with grease imbued with noxious herbs, hoping to discourage their ravenous masters from adding them to the meal.
cards.name: Dragonlord's Servant
cards.text: Dragon spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.flavor: "We speak the dragons' language of flame and rage. They speak our language of fury and honor. Together we shall weave a tale of destruction without equal."

cards.text: Dragon spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.

cards.name: Dragon Tempest
cards.text:
Whenever a creature with flying enters the battlefield under your control, it gains haste until end of turn.
Whenever a Dragon enters the battlefield under your control, it deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of Dragons you control.

cards.flavor: "If our former masters would have us kneel again, they shall feel our defiance slashed across their membranes."
cards.name: Drana, Kalastria Bloodchief
cards.text:
Flying
{X}{B}{B}: Target creature gets -0/-X until end of turn and Drana, Kalastria Bloodchief gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The bane of countless shattered weapons, each a failure to slay her."
—Daghatar the Adamant
cards.name: Dromoka, the Eternal
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a Dragon you control attacks, bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.flavor: They fell screaming into the depths of the chasm like so many pebbles tossed down a well.
cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.flavor: "I want to help Zendikar. Show me the way."—Nissa Revane

cards.flavor: Llanowar has seven elfhames, or kingdoms, each with its own ruler. Their palaces are objects of awe, wonder, and envy.

Cascade (When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.)

cards.flavor: Without the interfering hands of civilization, nature will always shape itself to its own needs.
cards.name: Evolving Wilds
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"It was a strange morning. When we awoke, we found our trees transformed. We didn't know whether to water them or polish them."
—Pulan, Bant orchardist
cards.name: Exotic Orchard
cards.text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

cards.flavor: "I often think on how excited they must feel to be chosen as my prey."
cards.name: Falkenrath Noble
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Falkenrath Noble or another creature dies, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: "How truly vast this city must be, that I have traveled so far and seen so much, yet never once found the place where the buildings fail."

cards.flavor:
"They had it coming." 
—Squire Imalia, savior of Thiswick

cards.flavor:
"What do you have that I cannot obtain?" 
—Mairsil, the Pretender
cards.name: Fellwar Stone
cards.text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

cards.flavor:
"It is all in my grasp. Every petty dream, every grand scheme, every soul, every fear. It all flows through me and from me." 
—Memnarch

—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum

—Chianul, Who Whispers Twice

cards.text: Tap an untapped Wizard you control: Return target nonland permanent you don't control to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Having flesh is increasingly a liability on Mirrodin.

cards.flavor: "Words lie. People lie. The land tells the truth."

cards.flavor: "You've begun to understand the hedrons' true purpose," said Ugin. "The Eldrazi can be imprisoned.""And how did that work out last time?" asked Jace.

cards.name: Herald's Horn
cards.text:
As Herald's Horn enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.

Creature spells you cast of the chosen type cost {1} less to cast.

At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. If it's a creature card of the chosen type, you may reveal it and put it into your hand.

cards.text:
Cats you control have protection from rats. (They can't be blocked, targeted, or dealt damage by Rats.)
At the beginning of your end step, target opponent creates a 1/1 black Rat creature token with deathtouch.
Whenever a Rat dies, put a +1/+1 counter on each Cat you control.

cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample and "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, draw that many cards."

Tap five untapped Wizards you control: Target player loses 7 life.

Flying
Whenever Intet, the Dreamer deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{U}. If you do, exile the top card of your library face down. You may look at that card for as long as it remains exiled. You may play that card without paying its mana cost for as long as Intet remains on the battlefield.
